com.ikalagaming.logging

Class Logging

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.logging.Logging

  • public class Logging
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles reporting and logging errors.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Method Detail

      • config

        public static void config(java.lang.String origin,
                          java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the config log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        severe(String, String), warning(String, String), info(String, String), fine(String, String), finer(String, String), finest(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

      • create

        public static void create()
        Sets up a static logger using the default event manager if one does not exist already.
        See Also:
        destory()

      • destory

        public static void destory()
        Shuts down the logger and clears out static variables. Note that if logs are requested after this, or the threshold is requested or changed, it will recreate the logger and start up again.
        See Also:
        create()

      • fine

        public static void fine(java.lang.String origin,
                        java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the fine log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        severe(String, String), warning(String, String), info(String, String), config(String, String), finer(String, String), finest(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

        public static void finer(java.lang.String origin,
                         java.lang.String details)

        details - What to log
        See Also:
        severe(String, String), warning(String, String), info(String, String), config(String, String), fine(String, String), finest(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

      • finest

        public static void finest(java.lang.String origin,
                          java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the finest log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        severe(String, String), warning(String, String), info(String, String), config(String, String), fine(String, String), finer(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

      • getLogLevel

        public static LogLevel getLogLevel()
        Returns the current logging level threshold. Logs below this are ignored, logs that are equal to or above the threshold are actually logged. If the logger is not initialized, it just returns the default threshold value.
        Returns:
        the threshold value for the logger
        See Also:
        setLogLevel(LogLevel)

      • info

        public static void info(java.lang.String origin,
                        java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the info log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        severe(String, String), warning(String, String), config(String, String), fine(String, String), finer(String, String), finest(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        Returns true if the logger has been created, false if it is in an uninitialized state.
        Returns:
        true if the logger has been created, false otherwise

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String origin,
                       LogLevel level,
                       java.lang.String details)
        Logs the provided information. Attempts to use localized names for the logging level. This only logs information that is above or equal to the logging threshold. If the logger is not initialized, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        level - The level of the requested log
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        create(), severe(String, String), warning(String, String), info(String, String), config(String, String), fine(String, String), finer(String, String), finest(String, String)

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(LogLevel newLevel)
        Sets the logging threshold to the given value. Logs below this are ignored, logs that are equal to or above the threshold are actually logged. If a null value is passed for some reason, the default level is used.
        If the logger is not initialized, a new one is created.
        Parameters:
        newLevel - the new level to use
        See Also:
        getLogLevel(), create()

      • severe

        public static void severe(java.lang.String origin,
                          java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the severe log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
        warning(String, String), info(String, String), config(String, String), fine(String, String), finer(String, String), finest(String, String), log(String, LogLevel, String)

      • warning

        public static void warning(java.lang.String origin,
                           java.lang.String details)
        Logs the given message at the warning log level.
        Parameters:
        origin - The plugin that is logging the info
        details - What to log
        See Also:
